translated: A bodhisattva accepts the occurrence of hypocrisy, flattery, intimidation, hinting, belittling, parroting, and the desire to acquire gain through gain.

original: de dag gis mi 'dzem la sel bar mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis mi 'dzem la sel bar mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If they do not avoid them and do not eliminate them, they are at fault and in violation.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are at fault with an afflicted offense.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyes shing 'bad pa rtsol la nyon mongs pa shas che bas sems zil gyis mnan te kun tu spyod pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyes shing 'bad pa rtsol la nyon mongs pa shas che bas sems zil gyis mnan te kun tu spyod pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If they are motivated to eliminate them, if they make an effort, if they are overwhelmed by the force of the mental affliction, and if they practice with a mind that is not free of attachment, they are not at fault.

original: 'phyar nas rab tu rgod la sogs //
analyzed: 'phyar nas rab tu rgod la sogs //
translated: If they are haughty, they are at fault for being arrogant.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rgod pas yongs su zin pa'i sems kyis rnam par ma zhi zhing rnam par ma zhi ba la dga' la rtag tu rgod pa dang / kun tu rtse zhing kun tu ca co 'don la rgod cing g-yeng bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rgod pas yongs su zin pa'i sems kyis rnam par ma zhi zhing rnam par ma zhi ba la dga' la rtag tu rgod pa dang / kun tu rtse zhing kun tu ca co 'don la rgod cing g-yeng bar byed pa dang /
translated: If a bodhisattva, overcome by agitation, does not have a mind that is calm and peaceful, does not enjoy a calm and peaceful state, is constantly agitated, is always playing around, laughing loudly, and being boisterous,

original: gzhan dag rgod du gzhug par 'dod cing dga' bar bya bar 'dod na rkyen de nyid kyis nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag rgod du gzhug par 'dod cing dga' bar bya bar 'dod na rkyen de nyid kyis nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: and if they want others to be agitated and want to amuse themselves, they are at fault and in violation due to those very circumstances.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: There is an afflicted offense.

original: brjed pas byas na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjed pas byas na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is done out of forgetfulness, there is an unafflicted offense.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed na ni nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed na ni nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If one generates the desire to remove it, there is no offense, as before.

original: gzhan dag gi kun nas mnar sems skye sa ba thabs des phyir bsal bar 'dod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi kun nas mnar sems skye sa ba thabs des phyir bsal bar 'dod na nyes pa med do //
translated: If one wishes to remove the ill will of others by that means, there is no offense.

original: gzhan dag gi mya ngan skyes pa bsal bar 'dod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi mya ngan skyes pa bsal bar 'dod na nyes pa med do //
translated: If one wishes to remove the grief of others, there is no offense.

original: gzhan de'i rang bzhin can de la dga' ba rnams bsdu ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan de'i rang bzhin can de la dga' ba rnams bsdu ba'am /
translated: If one does it in order to gather into one‚Äôs following those who are naturally fond of that person,

original: bag dbab pa'am /
analyzed: bag dbab pa'am /
translated: or in order to win them over,

original: de dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir byed na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir byed na nyes pa med do //
translated: or in order to conform with them, there is no offense.

original: gzhan dag byang chub sems dpa' la mi dga' bar 'gyur du dogs pa dang / kun nas mnar sems dang / rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur du dogs pa rnams la dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis nang du bsam pa dag pa bstan @178a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag byang chub sems dpa' la mi dga' bar 'gyur du dogs pa dang / kun nas mnar sems dang / rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur du dogs pa rnams la dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis nang du bsam pa dag pa bstan @178a * //
translated: If one suspects that others will not like the bodhisattva, or suspect that they will become ill-willed or hostile toward him, and if one shows an inner purity of mind by one‚Äôs natural fondness for them,

original: pa'i phyir byas na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: pa'i phyir byas na nyes pa med do //
translated: If you do so, there is no fault.

original: 'khor ba gcig tu bgrod par sems //
analyzed: 'khor ba gcig tu bgrod par sems //
translated: You should think of samsara as a single destination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' bas gnas par mi bya'i /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' bas gnas par mi bya'i /
translated: A bodhisattva should not abide in a state of delight in nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab kyis phyogs te gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab kyis phyogs te gnas par bya'o //
translated: He should abide with his back turned to nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be afraid of the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: de dag las sems kyang shin tu dben par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag las sems kyang shin tu dben par mi bya ste /
translated: He should not be completely detached from them.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du 'khor ba na 'khor zhing byang chub yang dag par bsgrub par bya dgos so snyam du de ltar lta zhing de skad smras na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du 'khor ba na 'khor zhing byang chub yang dag par bsgrub par bya dgos so snyam du de ltar lta zhing de skad smras na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te
translated: If a bodhisattva were to think and say, ‚ÄúI must seek enlightenment by wandering in samsara for three measureless kalpas,‚Äù he would incur a serious offense and a transgression,

original: / nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would be an afflicted offense.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpas ni nyan thos kyi ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba kun tu bsten par bya zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni nyan thos kyi ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba kun tu bsten par bya zhing /
translated: Bodhisattvas should rely on the listeners' complete delight in nirvanaüîΩand on their disenchantment with the afflictions and the subsidiary afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las sems skyo bar bya ba de las bye ba phrag 'bum 'gyur du mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba kun tu bsten par bya zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las sems skyo bar bya ba de las bye ba phrag 'bum 'gyur du mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba kun tu bsten par bya zhing /
translated: But they should do so to a degree a hundred thousand times greater than that.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las sems skyo ba bsgom par bya dgos te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las sems skyo ba bsgom par bya dgos te /
translated: They should cultivate disenchantment with the afflictions and the subsidiary afflictions.

original: 'di ltar nyan thos ni bdag gcig pu'i don la brtson gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos ni bdag gcig pu'i don la brtson gyi /
translated: For the listeners strive for their own goal alone,üîΩwhereas the bodhisattvas strive for the goal of all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa yin pa des de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la goms par bya ba yang dag par bsgrub dgos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa yin pa des de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la goms par bya ba yang dag par bsgrub dgos te /
translated: Therefore, they must correctly accomplish the practice of keeping their minds completely free of defilements.

original: de ni 'di ltar dgra bcom pa ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar dgra bcom pa ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: For even though they are not arhats,

original: de las khyad par du 'phags pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po la spyod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgrags pa ma yin mi spong ba //
analyzed: de las khyad par du 'phags pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po la spyod pa'i phyir ro // grags pa ma yin mi spong ba //
translated: It is even more so when it is associated with the absence of defilement.üîΩThe bodhisattva who does not avoid what is not of good repute

original: byang chub sems dpas bdag gi tshig mi btsun par 'gyur ba'i dri ngas dang / mi snyan pa dang / gtam ngan par 'gyur ba bden pa'i dngos po mi srung zhing sel bar mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bdag gi tshig mi btsun par 'gyur ba'i dri ngas dang / mi snyan pa dang / gtam ngan par 'gyur ba bden pa'i dngos po mi srung zhing sel bar mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te / nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: is in a situation of transgression, in a situation of offense, and it is an emotional offense.

original: bden pa'i dngos po ma yin pa mi srung zhing sel bar mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par ni 'gyur la /
analyzed: bden pa'i dngos po ma yin pa mi srung zhing sel bar mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par ni 'gyur la /
translated: If it is not a true situation, he is in a situation of transgression, in a situation of offense,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes @178b par ni mi 'gyur ro //üîΩpha rol mu stegs can yin nam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes @178b par ni mi 'gyur ro // pha rol mu stegs can yin nam /
translated: but it is not an emotional offense.

original: gzhan gang yang rung ba mngon par zhen pa zhig yin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gang yang rung ba mngon par zhen pa zhig yin na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the other person is a heretic,üîΩor if he is someone else who is very attached.

original: rab tu byung ba dang / slong mo spyod pa dang / dge ba spyod pa'i gzhis mi snyan par brjod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang / slong mo spyod pa dang / dge ba spyod pa'i gzhis mi snyan par brjod na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the criticism is directed at someone who has gone forth, who is begging for alms, or who is engaged in virtuous activities.

original: khro bas zil gyis non cing sems phyin ci log tu gyur pas brjod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: khro bas zil gyis non cing sems phyin ci log tu gyur pas brjod na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the criticism is made out of a sense of hostility or if the bodhisattva is mentally disturbed.

original: nyon mongs bcas kyang 'chos mi byed //
analyzed: nyon mongs bcas kyang 'chos mi byed //
translated: Even if he is afflicted, he should not fail to correct.

original: byang chub sems dpas gnod pa'i thabs dang thabs drag po gang gis sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba mthong bzhin du yid mi dga' bar 'gyur ba bsrung ba'i phyir thabs de mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //üîΩtshe 'di'i don chung ngu zhig tu gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gnod pa'i thabs dang thabs drag po gang gis sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba mthong bzhin du yid mi dga' bar 'gyur ba bsrung ba'i phyir thabs de mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te / nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro // tshe 'di'i don chung ngu zhig tu gyur la /
translated: If a bodhisattva sees that a certain method of correction would be beneficial for sentient beings but he or she does not carry it out because of a lack of sympathy, then he or she does incur an offense and a transgression, and it is also an afflicted offense.üîΩIf the benefit for sentient beings is small and the offense is great, there is no offense.

original: gzhi des yid mi dga' ba chen por gyur na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhi des yid mi dga' ba chen por gyur na nyes pa med do //
translated: If the benefit for sentient beings is small and the offense is great, there is no offense.

original: gshe la lan du gshe la sogs //
analyzed: gshe la lan du gshe la sogs //
translated: If he is reviled, he should not revile in return.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzan dag gshe ba la phyir gshe ba dang / khro ba la phyir khro ba dang brdeg pa la phyir brdeg pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba la phyir mtshang 'dru bar byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzan dag gshe ba la phyir gshe ba dang / khro ba la phyir khro ba dang brdeg pa la phyir brdeg pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba la phyir mtshang 'dru bar byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If a bodhisattva is abusive in return for abuse, angry in return for anger, strikes in return for being struck, or quarrels in return for being quarrelled with, he or she commits an offense and a transgression,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he or she acquires an afflicted offense.

original: khro ba rnams ni yal bar 'dor //
analyzed: khro ba rnams ni yal bar 'dor //
translated: But if he or she ignores the anger of those who are angry,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la nyes pa byas sam nyes pa byas su dogs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la nyes pa byas sam nyes pa byas su dogs kyang rung ste /
translated: if a bodhisattva, having been wronged by others or fearing that he or she might be wronged,

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pa dang / nga rgyal gyis non pas mthun par shad kyis byang bar mi byed cing de yal bar 'dor na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pa dang / nga rgyal gyis non pas mthun par shad kyis byang bar mi byed cing de yal bar 'dor na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: does not make amends by means of a conciliatory acknowledgment out of a sense of injured pride and a feeling of deep resentment, and if he or she ignores the matter, he or she commits an offense and a transgression,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he or she acquires an afflicted offense.

original: snyom las sam le lo'am bag med pas shad kyis byang bar ma byas na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par ni 'gyur la /
analyzed: snyom las sam le lo'am bag med pas shad kyis byang bar ma byas na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par ni 'gyur la /
translated: If one does not quickly purify by being diligent, then one is at fault and in violation.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par ni mi 'gyur ro //üîΩthabs des dul bar bya bar 'dod cing 'dul bar 'dod la mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par ni mi 'gyur ro // thabs des dul bar bya bar 'dod cing 'dul bar 'dod la mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste /
translated: If he does not do this, he commits an offense and a transgression, but not a sin.

original: dge ba'i gnas su 'god par 'dod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su 'god par 'dod na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he wants to discipline him by that means, if he wants to remove him from a nonvirtuous state and establish him in a virtuous state, there is no offense.

original: mu stegs can yin na nyes pa med do //üîΩrung ba ma yin pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par kun tu spyod pas shad kyis byang bar byed du 'jug par 'dod pa zhig na nyes pa med do //üîΩgal te rang bzhin gyis 'thab krol can zhig yin te rtsod par byed la shad kyis @179a * //
analyzed: mu stegs can yin na nyes pa med do // rung ba ma yin pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par kun tu spyod pas shad kyis byang bar byed du 'jug par 'dod pa zhig na nyes pa med do // gal te rang bzhin gyis 'thab krol can zhig yin te rtsod par byed la shad kyis @179a * //
translated: If the other person is a non-Buddhist, there is no offense.üîΩIf he wants to make him give up a wrongful and contemptible action, there is no offense.üîΩIf the other person is quarrelsome by nature, and if he will become more agitated and violent if he is made to give up his wrongful action, there is no offense.

original: byang bar byas na shas cher 'khrugs te shed skye bar 'gyur na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: byang bar byas na shas cher 'khrugs te shed skye bar 'gyur na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he is a person who is naturally violent, and if he will become more agitated and violent if he is made to give up his wrongful action, there is no offense.

original: pha rol bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin zhing kun nas mnar sems med pa'i ngang tshul can yin du re la /
analyzed: pha rol bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin zhing kun nas mnar sems med pa'i ngang tshul can yin du re la /
translated: If the other person is patient and not disposed to be hostile,

original: gzhan la bdag gis nyes pa byas pa las brtsams te shad kyis byang bar byed pa shin tu ngo tsha bar byed pa zhig yin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan la bdag gis nyes pa byas pa las brtsams te shad kyis byang bar byed pa shin tu ngo tsha bar byed pa zhig yin na nyes pa med do //
translated: and if the bodhisattva is ashamed to let the matter rest because of his own wrongdoing, there is no fault.

original: pha rol shad kyis 'chags pa spong //
analyzed: pha rol shad kyis 'chags pa spong //
translated: If the other person refuses to be reconciled,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rtsod pa byung ba 'ga' zhig las byung bar gyur nas gzhan dag la chos bzhin du mthun par shad kyis byang bar byed kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtsod pa byung ba 'ga' zhig las byung bar gyur nas gzhan dag la chos bzhin du mthun par shad kyis byang bar byed kyang /
translated: if a dispute has arisen among the bodhisattvas, and if they try to reconcile it according to the Dharma,

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan zhing gzhan la tho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas sam shad kyis sbyangs pa mi nyan na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan zhing gzhan la tho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas sam shad kyis sbyangs pa mi nyan na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: but the other person is hostile and refuses to listen to their reconciliation out of a desire to harm the other person, then they commit an offense and a transgression,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is an afflicted offense.

original: gal te kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang mi ldan gyi /
analyzed: gal te kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang mi ldan gyi /
translated: If they are not hostile,

original: mi bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas mi nyan na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas mi nyan na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is impatient and does not listen, he is at fault, but not with an afflicted offense.

original: thabs des pha rol gdul bar 'dod na nyes pa med de /
analyzed: thabs des pha rol gdul bar 'dod na nyes pa med de /
translated: If he wishes to discipline the other by that means, he is not at fault.

original: snga ma bzhin du thams cad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thams cad du rig par bya'o //
translated: All this should be understood as it was explained above.

original: chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin par shad kyis sbyong bar byed na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin par shad kyis sbyong bar byed na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he does not give advice and instruction in a manner that is contrary to the Dharma or at an inappropriate time, he is not at fault.

original: khro ba'i sems kyi rjes su 'jug / byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan dag la khro ba'i bsam pa byung zhing 'dzin pa byung ba dang du len na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khro ba'i sems kyi rjes su 'jug / byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan dag la khro ba'i bsam pa byung zhing 'dzin pa byung ba dang du len na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: When a bodhisattva is seized by thoughts of anger toward others, and he acquiesces in that attitude of anger, he is at fault, and he is in opposition to the training.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: His offense is an afflicted offense.

original: de spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed na nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed na nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If he generates the will to eliminate that attitude, he is not at fault.

original: bsnyen bkur 'dod phyir 'khor rnams sdud //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur 'dod phyir 'khor rnams sdud //
translated: He is at fault if he gathers a retinue for the sake of gain and honor.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rim gro bya ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba la yongs su zhen pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rim gro bya ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba la yongs su zhen pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is attached to service and honor

original: zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'khor sdud par byed na /
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'khor sdud par byed na /
translated: and who gathers a retinue with a mind that seeks material things

original: nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
